description.text: [Description]: Property to be delivered to handler is set.
[Description]: Role related to user principal is set. [Value Description]: Principal name set in accounts.xml of security.
[Description]: This element configures job list to be registered in scheduler.
[Description]: Role name contributed to principals is set.
[Description]: The address of sender for email is set for this field.
[Description]: Define truststore file path to be applied to current domain.
[Description]: Defines keystore file path to be applied to current domain.
[Description]: The value of property.

[Description]: File name in which this handler uses will be set for this field. If user has not set for this field, default file name of each logger will be used. Please refer to JEUS Server Manual for each default file name. [Example]: <file-name>C:\logs\mylog.log</file-name>
[Description]: This element binds as actual EJB JNDI name used in code. For example, it can lookup actual JNDI name "ACCEJB" (account EJB) as "ejb/account" within source code
[Description]: This element configures a single job to be registered in scheduler.
[Description]: This is option used as Servlet compiler and is not commonly used. [Value Description]: Compile option property used for compiling (Referencing <java-compiler>element)
[Description]: Time for object to be pooled is set for this field. [Performance Recommendation]:As this value is bigger, time cycle will be enlarged and traffic on server operation will be decreased.
[Description]: Principal name used as role of run-as-specified-identity within ejb-jar.xml or web.xml. [Value Description]: Principal name configured in subjects.xml of security.
[Description]: Handler to use in logger is set for this field.

[Description]: JSP workdir is location in which Servlet source file and class files are stored. Developer or administrator can use related directory for debugging purpose. This element is not generally needed to be used. [Value Description]: Absolute path used for compliling JSP. [Defined Value]: default : %SERVLET_HOME%\jspwork \enginename\GroupDocBase\DocBase
[Description]: Property value as selective matter. [Value Description]: Property value. [Example]: <value>c:\security\myAccounts.xml</value>
[Description]: Role permission class name to use is set. If it has not been set, it uses class in which JEUS provides as default.

[Description]: Fully qualified class name of formatter in which this handler is used. This class inherits java.util.logging.Formatter and jeus.util.logging.JeusFormatter will be constructed. [Example]: <formatter-class>com.tmax.logging.handler.MyHandler</formatter-class>
[Description]: In case of using handler in which user has created according to J2SE logging API, this setting
[Description]: Fully qualified class name of filer class set in this handler is set for this field. [Example]: <filter-class>com.tmax.logging.filter.MyFilter</filter-class>
[Description]: This is the handler to be used in case of displaying logging as file.
[Description]: When handler is generated, property to parse is set. These properties are delivered to handler as being stored in Map object as key-value through JeusHandler.setProperty() method.

[Description]: This property is value of configuring in ?encoding option when compiling generated Servlet source file through parsing JSP files. This configuration is not commonly used. Web Container automatically selects proper configuration. [Value Description]: Character set checking encoding scheme to use. For additional information, please refer to javac compiler documentation. [Defined Value]: [default] : This is automatically selected in Web Container.

[Description]: This element defines property as name-value pair in related security service as option. Please refer documentation on service class for explaination on each property which can be defined.
[Description]: This enables for users to use role without checking anything. [Example]: <unchecked/>
[Description]: The address of Smtp server to send email is set for this field.
[Description]: This element configures job name.

[Description]: If this property is set as "true", it enables to recompile related JSP file when executing included JSP file. Included JSP files are not checked for being updated. [Value Description]: Activating or inactivating this configuration as Boolean value. [Value Type Description]: Boolean [Defined Value]: [true] : Activating related configuration. [false]: Inactivating related configuration.
[Description]: This is the handler to use when sending logging to email. [Performance Recommandation]: There is a warning when a huge amount of email exist without proper filter.
[Description]: The address of receiver of email is set for this field.

[Description]: This element configures prot number of Web Server to process HTTP-RMI request. This Web Server/Web Container should be already in execution mode and RMI should be deployed. [Value Description]: Port number of Web Server to be connected by HTTP-RMI stub.
[Description]: Time cycel is configured in millisecond unit.
[Description]: The number of execution for this job is configured. [Defined Value]: [-1]: No limitation for number of execution.
[Description]: Configure the password for truststore file to be applied to current domain..
[Description]: This element configures time cycle for this job to executed.
[Description]: Time cycle is configured in minute unit.
[Description]: Encoding in which this handler leaves message is set for this field.
[Description]: Parameters of method are set by order.
[Description]: This value is used as parameter of corresponding wrapper class generator. [Example]: <value>100</value>

[Description]:Configure the size of buffer when this handler displays as file. [Value Description]: This is in the unit of byte. [Performance Recommandation]: As this value becomes larger, message to be displayed in file will be delayed, however, the performance of logging will be enhanced.

[Description]: In case of using and updating frequently on the file in which this handler uses for a certain amount of time. This setting is used for updating time unit. In this case, used date and time will be automaticallly followed right after file name in which this handler uses. [Value Description]: This represents in unit of hour and it should get divisor of 24 + N*24(n is integer greater than 0). [Example]: <valid-hour>3</valid-hour>

[Description]: JAVA type of environment variable. [Value Description]: Select single Java Type among java.lang.Boolean, java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Double, java.lang.Byte, java.lang.Short, java.lang.Long, java.lang.Float, java.lang.Character. [Example]: <type>java.lang.Integer</type>

[Description]: This element is handler used for sending to socket in which logging is set. [Performance Recommandation]: The performance will be decreased without using proper filter since logging message is transmitted as one Socket.
[Description]: Time cycle is configured in time unit.
[Description]: The mimimum value of being pooled.
[Description]: This element configures terminating time of this job. If terminating time is not given, job will not be terminated.
[Description]: Level of logging is set for this field. Please refer to Level class of logging API of J2SE.

[Description]: File in which this handler uses will be used and updated frequently for certain set amount of time . This setting is used for changing file as unit of day. In this case, used date will be followed right after file name. [Value Description]: day [Example]: <valid-day>1</valid-day>
[Description]: Explaination of this job can be written for this field.
[Description]: Time cycle is configured in date unit.

[Description]: Specify this logger when you apply the settings for other loggers (jeus.transaction, jeus.jndi, etc.) except for basic loggers (jeus, jeus.ejb, jeus.servlet, jeus.jms, etc.). You don't need to specify name in typical situations. If you want to know the logger name, you can refer to the separate logger page. If logging setting is at <node> or <EngineContainer> and this element is omitted, the name should be jeus logger. If specified under the engine, it always means the logger settings of each engine. Therefore, the name will be ignored. For the default container, the name is ignored because the logging settings of the node will be used.
[Description]: The mimimum value of being pooled.
[Description]: This handler will be used when logging is left in the screen.
[Description]: Port of sending messages when generating this handler.
[Description]: Actual JNDI name defined in JEUS DD. [Example]: <export-name>ACCEJB</export-name>

[Description]: URI path of RMI Handler Servlet (jeus.rmi.http.ServletHandler) called by HTTP-RMI stub should be configured. This URL configures only Servlet request path except for Protocol, Web Server IP and Port number. Protocol is assumed to contain IP address such HTTP, RMI execution environment and Web Server. ( This means Web Server and Web Container should receive HTTP-RMI request.) Port number should be configured in element(HTTP_port) explained in the following. [Value Description]: Servlet Context Path expressing RMI Handler Servlet [Example]: <url>/mycontext/RMIHandlerServlet</url>
[Description]: Fully qualified class name of parameter of this method is set. [Example]: java.lang.String
[Description]: Exaplaination on this security permission setting can be written for this field.
[Description]: This configures whether to operate Scheduler Service. [Defined Value]: [true] : activate it [false]: inactivate it.
[Description]: Action for this role permission object is defined. There is no action for role permission

[Description]: This element determines availabiltiy of storing java source file after generating Servlet Class File through compiling source file generated from JSP page. These files are useful for debugging purpose. [Value Description]: This configuration activates or inactivates as Boolean value. [Value Type Description]: Boolean [Defined Value]: default : true true : Maintaining Java Source File. false : Deleting Java Source File.
[Description]: IP address of sending messages when generating this handler.

[Description]: In case where file in which this handler uses already exists, this element will be used for determining whether to be written after the file name. If it has been set as flase, existing file will be deleted.
[Description]: This element configures export name and reference name of each resource reference to be registered in JNDI of this Engine Container.
[Description]: The name of handler will be set. At this moment, this name should be set as unique in a logger. This name is used for refering handler including tool. [Example]: <name>handler1</name>
[Description]: Configure the keypassword for keystore file applied to current domain.

[Description]: Through configuring this property, generated class files can be placed in other directory besides <jsp-work-dir> directory. If this property is not set, class files will be located in jspwork directory. This element is not commonly used. [Value Description]: Absolute path used for storing JSP class files. [Defined Value]: default : %SERVLET_HOME%\jspwork \enginename\GroupDocBase\DocBase
[Description]: This disables for users to use role. [Example]: <excluded/>

[Description]: When messages enter into this handler through using log() method of logger registered in this handler, it determines whether to consider it as the sender object of email. If it has been set as false, messages which are only called through using specific send() method are transmitted.
[Description]: This element is fully qualified name of class to execute job.
[Description]: Property to parse to formatter when handler is generated. This properties are delivered to formatter through using JeusFormatter.setProperty() method stored in Map object.
[Description]: Time for object to be pooled is set for this field. [Performance Recommendation]:As this value is bigger, time cycle will be enlarged and traffic on server operation will be decreased.
[Description]: This element configures thread pool used when executing job as multi-thread in schedule.
[Description]: This element configures starting time of this job. If starting time is not given, job is immediately started.
[Description]: Fully qualified class name of filter class set in this logger is set for this field. [Example]: <filter-class>com.tmax.logging.filter.MyFilter</filter-class>
[Description]: The maximum value of being pooled.
[Description]: Name of method is set. [Example]: foo
[Description]: Increased quantity will be specified as object to be pooled is increased.

[Description]: Specifies the level of the handler. Messages will only be output if the level of the message that passes through logger is included within the specified handler level. (For the Access log, items over the INFO level are not output.)
[Description]: This element is the key value of property.
[Description]: The bcc-address of receiver is set for this field.

[Description]: This element configures Java Compiler for compiling Java source code of eJSP. It is not recommended since default configuration is the most efficent way. [Value Description]: Character set and compiler configuring java compiler should be included within system path in order to execute. [Defined Value]: [sun.tools.javac] : SUN Microsystems Java Compiler in which "tools.jar" is included is used (This configuration is recommended). [javac] : This element configures external "javac" compiler including in system path. [com.sun.tools.javac] : This is operated in serveral systems. If this operates, this is priotized option since it is more efficent and stable than sun.tools.javac.

[Description]: This element can declare reference name to be used in source code. [Value Description]: Reference name to be binded in actual JNDI name. This element corresponds with ref-name of J2EE Standard descriptor element. [Example]: <ref-name>ejb/AccountEJB</ref-name>

[Description]: Fully qualified class name in which user has created is set. This class inherits java.util.logging.Handler and jeus.util.logging.JeusHandler will be constructed. [Example]: <handler-class>com.tmax.logging.handler.MyHandler</handler-class>
[Description]: Configure the password for keystore file applied to current domain.
[Description]: The maximum value of being pooled.
[Description]: Name of environment variable used in code. [Example]: <name>minAmount</name>
[Description]: Java Class name extending one among jeus.security.spi classes. [Value Description]: Java Class Name [Example]: <classname>mypackage.MyAutenticationService</classname>
[Description]: The cc-address of receiver is set for this field.
[Description]: This determines whether handlers of parent logger will be used for this logger.
[Description]: Variable name [Value Description]: Variable name [Example]: <name>filename</name>
[Description]: This is the level of SEVERE. It supports for compatibility as logger level of JEUS 4.x.
[Description]: This is the level of WARNING. It supports for compatibility as logger level of JEUS 4.x.
[Description]: This is the level of INFO. It supports for compatibility as logger level of JEUS 4.x.
[Description]: This is the level belonging to FINE. It supports for compatibility as logger level of JEUS 4.x.
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Description]: Please refer to Level class documentation of J2SE Logging API.
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Enumeration Display]: false
[Description]: In case of using Oracle DBMS
[Description]: In case of using Informix DBMS
[Description]: In case of using IBM DB2 DBMS
[Description]: In case of using Microsoft SQL Server DBMS
[Description]: In case of using Sybase DBMS
[Description]: In case of using HSQL DBMS
[Description]: In case of using Cloudscape DBMS
[Description]: In case of using MySQL DBMS

[Description]: Each entity bean instance has exclusive access and a one-to-one relationship with the database row that it represents. This means that the EJB engine can skip all the ejbLoad() calls to this bean since it will know that no other entity bean will access and modify the data while the instance is alive. The engine thus calls ejbLoad() only once when the bean is created and then assumes that no changes are made to the DB so that no more ejbLoad() calls have to be made. This setting can NOT be used when the bean is part of a cluster. It must also be remembered that the database should only be allowed to be modified by the WAS (external non-WAS access should be disallowed).

[Description]: With this setting, several EJBs in different EJB engines may be mapped to the same database row. ejbLoad() will be called before every request to the entity bean. This setting (or MULTIPLE_OBJECT) is thus required when you cluster EJBs of the same type. The difference from the MULITPLE_OBJECT setting is that within each EJB engine, only ONE EJB entity bean will be assigned to handle all EJB client requests (thereby the term "single object"). Other requests arriving to the same EJB engine while the EJB instance is already tied up will cause the new requests to wait until the processing is finished.

[Description]: With this setting, several EJBs in different EJB engines may be mapped to the same database row. ejbLoad() will be called before every request to the entity bean. This setting (or SINGLE_OBJECT) is thus required when you cluster EJBs of the same type. The difference from the SINGLE_OBJECT setting is that within each EJB engine, serveral EJB entity bean instances will be spawned to handle all EJB client requests concurrently (thereby the term "mulitple object"). Other requests arriving to the EJB engine while previous requests are being processed will thus NOT have to wait like they do in SINGLE_OBJECT mode.
[Description]: Oracle JDBC driver
[Description]: Sybase JDBC driver
[Description]: JEUS MS SQL Server driver
[Description]: DB2 JDBC driver
[Description]: Other JDBC drivers
[Value Type Description]: The default value is in non-negative int type. In case where the value is -1, it is considered as off.
[Value Type Description]: This element is int type which is over 0. Thus, it includes values which are over 0 in the range of int type.
[Value Type Description]: This element is long type which is over 0. Thus, it includes values which are over 0 in the range of long type.
[Value Type Description]: The default value is in non-negative int type. It permits values which are over 0 in the range of int type.
[Value Type Description]: This element is used as brokerID of JMS broker. 0 is reserved as local brokerID.
[Value Type Description]: The default value is in unsigned long type. In case where the value is -1, it is considered as off.
[Value Type Description]: Rate as float type between 0 and 1.
